bibl.title: El ""Receptum Nautarum"" y el Papiro Grenf. II 108.
bibl.note: It cannot be ruled out that a document such as P. Grenf. II, 108 refers not to the conclusion of the receptum nautarum, but to a receipt given by a docker to the ship operator, to certify his correct compliance with the ""received-for-shipment"" business or, at least, with the corresponding locatio conductio. - Avec résumés en espagnol et en anglais.
bibl.seg: Patricio-Ignacio Carjaval, El ""Receptum Nautarum"" y el Papiro Grenf. II 108.

It cannot be ruled out that a document such as P. Grenf. II, 108 refers not to the conclusion of the receptum nautarum, but to a receipt given by a docker to the ship operator, to certify his correct compliance with the ""received-for-shipment"" business or, at least, with the corresponding locatio conductio. - Avec résumés en espagnol et en anglais.
